uk.org.taverna.server.client
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  uk.org.taverna.server.client.Server

public final class Server
extends Object

The Server class represents a connection to a Taverna Server instance somewhere on the Internet. Only one instance of this class is created for each Taverna Server instance. To make a connection to a server call connect(URI) with it full URL as the parameter. If there already exists a Server instance that is connected to this Taverna Server then it will be returned, otherwise a new Server instance is created and returned.

Author:
Robert Haines

connect

public static Server connect(String uri)
                      throws URISyntaxException
Connect to a Taverna Server.

Parameters:
uri - The address of the server to connect to in the form http://server:port/location
Returns:
a Server instance representing the connection to the specified Taverna Server.
Throws:
URISyntaxException - if the provided URI is badly formed.

uploadRunFile

public String uploadRunFile(String id,
                            File file,
                            String uploadLocation,
                            String rename,
                            UserCredentials credentials)
                     throws IOException
Upload a file to the server for use by a run.

Parameters:
id - the id of the run to upload to.
file - the file to upload.
uploadLocation - the location to upload to. This should be the full URI.
rename - optionally rename the file at the remote location. Pass null or the empty string to ignore.
Returns:
the name of the file on the remote server. This will be unchanged unless rename was used.
Throws:
IOException
See Also:
#uploadRunFile(id, File, String), #uploadRunFile(Run, File, String, String), #uploadRunFile(Run, File, String)
